headline: ‘An Undeniable Crisis’: Gang Violence Rocks Prisons in Mississippi
abstract: Five inmates were slain last week, and two inmates escaped. The violence has illuminated an understaffed system troubled by gang warfare.
lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — Betty Turner dreaded what her son would face in the state penitentiary in Parchman, the Mississippi Delta prison that has, over the course of more than a century, earned a dark and near-mythic reputation for cruelty and institutional racism. Her fears were realized when he described meals of just a slice of bologna with a packet of mustard, sightings of rats and mold, and nights spent on a mat on a cold, damp floor.
